title: Mark Zuckerberg Says Apple One Of Facebook's Biggest Competitors Now
text: Facebook Inc (NASDAQ: FB) CEO Mark Zuckerberg said that Apple Inc (NASDAQ: AAPL) has emerged as a potent competitor to the social networking giant. What Happened: Zuckerberg used the opening statement at the company's fourth-quarter earnings conference call to lambast the Cupertino, California-based iPhone maker.

title: Facebook Advertising Revenue Surges Amid Instagram eCommerce Tab Rollout
text: Facebook, Inc. reported on Wednesday (Jan. 27) as part of its Q4 and full year 2020 earnings that total revenue surged 33 percent year-over-year for the three months ended Dec. 31, 2020. The social media company reported $27.19 billion in advertising revenue for the quarter, marking a 31 percent year-over-year rise.

title: Facebook (FB) Q4 Earnings and Revenues Surpass Estimates
text: Facebook (FB) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of 19.75% and 6.22%, respectively, for the quarter ended December 2020. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

title: Stock Market Falls Hard As S&P 500, Nasdaq Suffer Distribution Days; Apple, Facebook Earnings In Focus
text: Sellers hit the stock market hard Wednesday despite a strong profit report from Dow Jones stock Microsoft. Volume came in much higher than Tuesday.

title: Mark Zuckerberg says Apple is now one of Facebook's biggest competitors
text: Facebook has blasted privacy changes coming to iPhones and iPads that would reveal more details about what information Facebook collects.

title: Facebook Beats the Street Thanks to Stellar Ad Sales
text: Earnings jumped by 52% in the fourth quarter and free cash flow nearly doubled.

title: Facebook will stop recommending political groups permanently
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg on Wednesday announced that the company will no longer recommend civic and political groups to its users.

title: Facebook profit jumped 53% amid growing scrutiny
text: Facebook's business continues to fire on all cylinders even as the company faces growing scrutiny from regulators over its acquisitions and from critics for the role its platform may have played in spreading lies about the US presidential election.

title: Facebook's daily active users decline for a second quarter in the United States and Canada
text: Facebook's top-line numbers were as robust as ever, but there are signs of user fatigue. Facebook Inc. posted its fourth-quarter earnings after the bell on Wednesday, its first since the 2020 presidential election, when its role in the spread of misinformation became yet another flashpoint in the wider debate about Big Tech's control over online speech.

title: Facebook exceeds fourth quarter earnings even as its stocks drop
text: The company reported a revenue of $28bn, beating predictions of $26bn, but a bad day at the market saw up to a 6% decrease

title: Facebook's Strong Results Are Offset by Cautious Comments About 2021
text: Facebook's revenue rose 33% to $28.1 billion in the fourth-quarter, but the company said that a change to Apple's iOS software could impact future results.

title: Facebook's Uncertain Outlook Spooks Investors
text: Jan.27 -- Facebook Inc.'s fourth-quarter sales jumped 33%, with online shopping during the pandemic fueling demand for digital ads on its social networks. Bloomberg Intelligence's Mandeep Singh has more on "Bloomberg Markets: The Close.

title: Facebook sees earnings grow but warns Apple iOS changes could hurt business
text: The social network says upcoming privacy changes to iOS could weigh on its ad business.

title: Facebook's Q4 Earnings Beat Doesn't Seem That Impressive to Investors
text: Facebook, Inc. (NASDAQ: FB) released its most recent quarterly results after the closing bell on Wednesday.

title: Facebook posts a 33 percent increase in revenue and a 53 percent jump in profit.
text: Facebook on Wednesday reported surging profits and revenue driven by soaring ad sales, but cautioned that it might face “headwinds” in the future from regulation and technology changes.

title: Facebook predicts ‘significant' obstacles to ad targeting and revenue in 2021
text: While Facebook's fourth quarter earnings report included solid user and revenue numbers, the company sounded a note of caution for 2021. In the “CFO outlook” section of the earnings release, Facebook said it anticipates facing “more significant advertising headwinds” this year.

title: Facebook Posts Solid Q4 Earnings Beat But Warns Of 2021 “Cross Currents”; Daily Active Users At 1.84B
text: Facebook reported strong fourth-quarter financials but spooked markets a bit by warning of advertising headwinds this year. Revenue was $28.1 billion. Net profit hit $11.2 billion, or $3.94 a share — both beating Wall Street forecasts. Monthly active users of 1.84 billion were up 11% year-on-year but about flat from the previous quarter. “We had...

title: I like what I see so far of Facebook's earnings: MKM Partners' Kulkarni
text: MKM Partners Rohit Kulkarni joins 'Closing Bell' to weigh in on Facebook's fourth quarter results.

title: Facebook beat on top and bottom lines in fourth quarter earnings
text: Julia Boorstin joins 'Closing Bell' to report Facebook's fourth quarter earnings results, which had a beat on both the top and bottom lines. In its outlook, the company has said it will continue to face "significant uncertainties" and face more significant ad targeting headwinds in 2021.

title: Facebook blows away Q4 revenue and profit expectations as digital advertising rebounds (FB)
text: Facebook on Wednesday reported record numbers for its fourth-quarter earnings and revenue, beating Wall Street's expectations. The company generated $28.1 billion in revenue in Q4 2020, up 33% year-on-year.

title: Earnings Results: Facebook shares tumble 5% on warning of ‘cross currents' in 2021
text: Facebook Inc. shares tumbled 5% in extended trading Wednesday after it announced better-than-expected fourth-quarter results, but warned of "significant uncertainty as we manage through a number of cross currents in 2021."

title: Facebook Reports Q4 Earnings Beat, Active Users Up 11% To 1.84B
text: Facebook (NASDAQ: FB) reported quarterly earnings of $3.88 per share on Wednesday, which beat the analyst consensus estimate of $3.22 by 20.5%. This is a 51.56% increase over earnings of $2.56 per share from the same period last year.

title: Facebook beats quarterly revenue expectations
text: Facebook Inc beat analysts' estimates for quarterly revenue on Wednesday, powered by increased ad spending by businesses to capitalize on a holiday shopping season driven online by the pandemic.

title: Facebook Reports Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2020 Results

text: Facebook (FB) expands Facebook News internationally with UK launch and boosts content through paid partnerships with UK news outlets amid rising concerns over dominance of online advertising.

title: Triple Crown Of Earnings Season: Facebook, Apple, Tesla At The Starting Gate Later

title: Facebook investors, shrugging off election woes, look for 'social commerce' payday
text: Facebook Inc may face questions about fallout from U.S. election controversies when it posts earnings on Wednesday, but top of mind for investors is a less political matter: the company's heavy bet on e-commerce to drive ad sales.
